results.title: Intramuscular atenolol and levetiracetam reduce mortality in a rat model of paraoxon-induced status epilepticus.
results.text_hl: Here, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@AT@@@ + @CHEMICAL_Levetiracetam @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077287 @@@LV@@@ therapy produced significant reductions in @CHEMICAL_Paraoxon @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010261 @@@POX@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@SE@@@ mortality assessed at 30 days post-@<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@SE@@@.

citations.NLM: Deshpande LS, Blair RE, Halquist M, Kosmider L, DeLorenzo RJ. Intramuscular atenolol and levetiracetam reduce mortality in a rat model of paraoxon-induced status epilepticus. Ann N Y Acad Sci. 2020 Nov;1480(1):219-232. PMID: 32961584
citations.BibTeX: @article{32961584, title={Intramuscular atenolol and levetiracetam reduce mortality in a rat model of paraoxon-induced status epilepticus.}, author={Deshpande LS and Blair RE and Halquist M and Kosmider L and DeLorenzo RJ}, journal={Ann N Y Acad Sci}, volume={1480}, number={1}, pages={219-232}}

results.title: beta adrenergic blockade prevents cardiac dysfunction following status epilepticus in rats.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_10116 @@@Rats@@@ subjected to @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@SE@@@ received either vehicle (saline) or the B1 adrenergic antagonist @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@AT@@@) prior to and during 90 min of @DISEASE_Seizures @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizure@@@ activity.

citations.NLM: Little JG, Bealer SL. beta adrenergic blockade prevents cardiac dysfunction following status epilepticus in rats. Epilepsy Res. 2012 May;99(3):233-9. PMID: 22209271
citations.BibTeX: @article{22209271, title={beta adrenergic blockade prevents cardiac dysfunction following status epilepticus in rats.}, author={Little JG and Bealer SL}, journal={Epilepsy Res}, volume={99}, number={3}, pages={233-9}}

results.title: Atenolol offers better protection than clonidine against cardiac injury in kainic acid-induced status epilepticus.
results.text_hl: We suggest that modulation of sympathetic activity by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ provides a promising cardioprotective approach in @<m>DISEASE_Status_Epilepticus</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013226 @@@status epilepticus@@@.

citations.NLM: Read MI, Harrison JC, Kerr DS, Sammut IA. Atenolol offers better protection than clonidine against cardiac injury in kainic acid-induced status epilepticus. Br J Pharmacol. 2015 Oct;172(19):4626-38. PMID: 25765931
citations.BibTeX: @article{25765931, title={Atenolol offers better protection than clonidine against cardiac injury in kainic acid-induced status epilepticus.}, author={Read MI and Harrison JC and Kerr DS and Sammut IA}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={172}, number={19}, pages={4626-38}}
